snippet: Militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, who swept into the towns and forced thousands of locals to flee the fighting, were within striking distance of the nation’s largest dam.
abstract: Sunni extremists seize control of three towns in northern Iraq after fierce battles with Kurdish security forces, sending thousands of people fleeing to nearby mountains and threatening the country’s largest dam.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, who swept into the towns and forced thousands of locals to flee the fighting, were within striking distance of the nation’s largest dam.

headline.main: Sunni Extremists in Iraq Seize 3 Towns From Kurds and Threaten Major Dam
headline.print_headline: Sunni Extremists in Iraq Seize 3 Towns From Kurds and Threaten Major Dam

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
